item.title: B-19 Fleet by Raphael Lacoste
item.description:
¬¥B-19 Fleet‚Äô
3dsmax and Photoshop, spent a bunch of time testing renders, less time in 2d, but fun to make . it is quite efficient to experiment light direction and impact on composition,
Looks like I can still stand spending hours rendering 3D üòÅ
Hope you like !

item.title: On The Tracks by Raphael Lacoste
item.description:
Hey There,

I‚Äôve been taking lots of photos while traveling in airports and taking planes, being fascinated by the machinery and aircrafts since my young age...I finally decided to create this scifi piece using some of my shots. It is in my plans to make more like these, I have plenty of inspiring pictures to use üôÇ enjoy !
item.content:encoded:
Hey There,

I‚Äôve been taking lots of photos while traveling in airports and taking planes, being fascinated by the machinery and aircrafts since my young age...I finally decided to create this scifi piece using some of my shots. It is in my plans to make more like these, I have plenty of inspiring pictures to use üôÇ enjoy !

item.title: The Wall - AI City by Raphael Lacoste
item.description:
Hey there!

Worked on a concept using the 3D scene from another project.
wanted to bring to life this impressive and threatening human less city driven by AI and robots, this large place being surrounded by Lush nature, grasslands and wild animals ...

3DS Max and Photoshop

Hey there!

Worked on a concept using the 3D scene from another project.
wanted to bring to life this impressive and threatening human less city driven by AI and robots, this large place being surrounded by Lush nature, grasslands and wild animals ...

item.title: Prince of Alhambra by Raphael Lacoste
item.description:
Illustration done for my Environment design Workshop at Lightbox Expo 2019.
After a trip in Spain , I took lots of picture in Granada and wanted to make a tribute to this amazing architectural masterpiece.
3D scene , textured and light in 3dsMax. Painting in photoshop.
enjoy
item.content:encoded:
Illustration done for my Environment design Workshop at Lightbox Expo 2019.
After a trip in Spain , I took lots of picture in Granada and wanted to make a tribute to this amazing architectural masterpiece.
3D scene , textured and light in 3dsMax. Painting in photoshop.
enjoy

item.title: Great Temple by Raphael Lacoste
item.description:
Coming back to my Massive Blocks structure I worked on for my 5 years old piece ¬´ migration ¬ª. Obviously the monks had a long journey ! üôÇ
3D composition done in 3ds Max, textures from my last trip in Granada this summer, rest done in the late hours on Photoshop. A bit tired this morning üòõ hope you like.

item.title: Mushy Land 2.0 by Raphael Lacoste
item.description: My dater wanted me to draw some mushrooms and it ended as a full fantasi matt painting over the top ü§∑‚Äç‚ôÄÔ∏è anyway it was a good exxercise...25 years ago I would have never thought that having kids and brainstorming with dem could also be an infinite inspirati, helping you to step bc on the little personal issu, helping you to keep your young soule. I feel bless I had kids, and I love them :-)

item.title: Bug Invasion by Raphael Lacoste
item.description:
Hello There,

Been working on this one for a while,
I spent some time tweaking my AT-AT spiders 3D models I rendered in Max first. Then, I took a trip in south Quebec with my camera this winter, to take photo references for mood and composition inspiration... hope you like, feel free to comment ;-)

Thanks
item.content:encoded:
Hello There,

Been working on this one for a while,
I spent some time tweaking my AT-AT spiders 3D models I rendered in Max first. Then, I took a trip in south Quebec with my camera this winter, to take photo references for mood and composition inspiration... hope you like, feel free to comment ;-)

Thanks

item.title: " L I G N E S " a Book of Drawings by Raphael Lacoste
item.description:
Hello Everyone!

Very good news, my new Artbook is available on my BigCartel Here:
https://raphaellacoste.bigcartel.com/product/l-i-g-n-e-s

This one is only focused on traditional drawings, back to the basics my friends üòâ every copy is signed and shipped from Canada.

**Format and Details**

8,5x11 inches (21x28cm) Soft Cover Artbook.

Scratch Free Matte Cover finish.

68 Pages, high quality opaque paper.

"L I G N E S" is the second artbook of Raphael Lacoste, Illustrator and Art Director.

This books is showcasing a collection of selected ink and pencil sketches, made by the artist between 2015 and 2018.
In his new artbook, Raphael wanted to focus purely on linework and drawing, challenging himself to spend more time away from computers with traditional medias.

‚úì 4 pages Exclusive interview of Raphael Lacoste by Roberto Irace, 2017

‚úì Pubication design by Brent Ashe

‚úì Texts in both English and French

‚úì Translation and editing by Anouk Bachman
item.content:encoded:
Hello Everyone!

Very good news, my new Artbook is available on my BigCartel Here:
https://raphaellacoste.bigcartel.com/product/l-i-g-n-e-s

This one is only focused on traditional drawings, back to the basics my friends üòâ every copy is signed and shipped from Canada.

**Format and Details**

8,5x11 inches (21x28cm) Soft Cover Artbook.

Scratch Free Matte Cover finish.

68 Pages, high quality opaque paper.

"L I G N E S" is the second artbook of Raphael Lacoste, Illustrator and Art Director.

This books is showcasing a collection of selected ink and pencil sketches, made by the artist between 2015 and 2018.
In his new artbook, Raphael wanted to focus purely on linework and drawing, challenging himself to spend more time away from computers with traditional medias.

‚úì 4 pages Exclusive interview of Raphael Lacoste by Roberto Irace, 2017

‚úì Pubication design by Brent Ashe

‚úì Texts in both English and French

‚úì Translation and editing by Anouk Bachman

item.title: *Advanced Environment Design Gumroad Tutorial* by Raphael Lacoste
item.description:
Hello !

I finally took the time to finish my new Gumroad Yeah !
here is the link : https://gumroad.com/l/uYtoK

in this tutorial, learn how to design a fantasy environment scene from a simple rough sketch to a final rendered illustration.

Process for advanced and intermediate photoshop users. Learn how to keep a simple, clear composition, and bring to life the drawing into a rich environment design.

- 90 minutes of commented video.

- From Sketching in procreate (or traditional) to final rendered image tips.

- Design and Composition tips, environment design of a Fantasy Scene.

- Photobashing and editing (Photoshop CC).

- Advanced digital illustration Process and rendering.

- Brushes and PSD file in the Tutorial !
item.content:encoded:
Hello !

I finally took the time to finish my new Gumroad Yeah !
here is the link : https://gumroad.com/l/uYtoK

in this tutorial, learn how to design a fantasy environment scene from a simple rough sketch to a final rendered illustration.

Process for advanced and intermediate photoshop users. Learn how to keep a simple, clear composition, and bring to life the drawing into a rich environment design.

- 90 minutes of commented video.

- From Sketching in procreate (or traditional) to final rendered image tips.

- Design and Composition tips, environment design of a Fantasy Scene.

- Photobashing and editing (Photoshop CC).

- Advanced digital illustration Process and rendering.

- Brushes and PSD file in the Tutorial !

item.title: Dusk on the Nile Valley by Raphael Lacoste
item.description:
Artwork created to set Artistic direction of the Nile Delta Biome on Assassin's Creed Origins.
I did a couple of benchmark illustrations I will be happy to share this Fall
hope you like the game when it's out October 27th
